**Description**
---------------

The Correctional Service Canada has a requirement to provide simulation-based training for nursing personnel on the Nursing Clinical Protocols (NCP) for emergency situations. The scope of work includes:

* Providing a maximum of 12 full-day clinical simulation and lab sessions for correctional service staff
* Developing and delivering training programs tailored to the needs of correctional services staff
* Utilizing high-fidelity clinical simulations and labs to meet training objectives
* Providing support during all clinical simulation sessions
* Delivering training materials and supplies for the training sessions

**Eligibility**
--------------

The supplier must meet the following minimum essential requirements:

* Have provided a minimum of 3 training sessions in the last 5 years that included adapting training programs to reflect the specific needs and limitations of healthcare delivery in correctional environments
* Have provided a minimum of 3 training sessions to nurses in the last 5 years that were delivered by registered health professionals with licenses in good standing
* Have a lab set up to reflect the correctional service institutional environment

**Trade Agreements**
-------------------

This procurement is subject to the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement, and Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement.
